title: Choose the Correct Verb Stem
instruction: Select the correct verb form to complete each sentence from classical Buddhist texts.

questions.question: Complete with a PAST verb: རྒྱལ་སྲས་ཀྱིས་བདག་ཉིད་གཞན་དང ___ (The bodhisattva exchanged self for others.) [37 Practices]
questions.transliteration: rgyal sras kyis bdag nyid gzhan dang ___
questions.english: The bodhisattva exchanged self for others.
questions.hint: The past stem typically has a བ- prefix and -ས suffix.

questions.question: Complete with a FUTURE verb: དགེ་བ་ཐམས་ཅད་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ ___ (All virtue shall be dedicated toward enlightenment.) [Samantabhadra's Prayer]
questions.transliteration: dge ba thams cad byang chub tu ___
questions.english: All virtue shall be dedicated toward enlightenment.
questions.hint: The future stem has the བ- prefix but no -ས suffix.

questions.question: Complete with an IMPERATIVE verb: སེམས་ལ ___ (Look at the mind!) [Meditation instruction]
questions.hint: The imperative drops the བ- prefix. Compare: བལྟ (present) → ལྟོས (imperative).

questions.question: Complete with a PRESENT verb: རྒྱལ་སྲས་ཀྱིས་སེམས་ཅན་གྱི་དོན ___ (The bodhisattva works for sentient beings' benefit.) [37 Practices]
questions.transliteration: rgyal sras kyis sems can gyi don ___
questions.english: The bodhisattva works for sentient beings' benefit.
questions.hint: The present stem is the base form without modifications.

questions.question: Complete with a PAST verb: དགེ་སློང་གིས་ཤེས་རབ་སྙིང་པོ ___ (The monk recited the Heart Sutra.) [Heart Sutra]
questions.transliteration: dge slong gis shes rab snying po ___
questions.english: The monk recited the Heart Sutra.
questions.hint: The past stem of བཀླག keeps the བ- prefix and adds the -ས suffix.

correctFeedback: Correct! You know which verb stem to use for each tense.
incorrectFeedback: Review the four stems: present (base), past (བ- prefix + -ས suffix), future (བ- prefix), imperative (drop བ-, add -ས).
